decks.notes: This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also utilizes creatures with powerful enter-the-battlefield effects, such as Abhorrent Oculus and Murktide Regent, to control the board. The deck aims to control the pace of the game, disrupting the opponent's strategy while setting up its win conditions. By carefully managing resources and making efficient plays, this deck can outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through attrition and strategic spellcasting.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards and utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Burning Inquiry, and Goblin Lore to discard cards and bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Ox of Agonas. Marauding Mako and Flameblade Adept help apply pressure to the opponent early on, while Detective's Phoenix and Flamewake Phoenix provide additional threats. Fear of Missing Out and Arena of Glory provide additional support and protection for the creatures, allowing for a fast and aggressive playstyle to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient and direct burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm, combined with fast and evasive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of damage, while also disrupting their life gain with cards like Skullcrack and Lightning Helix. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of fetch lands and fast lands for consistency.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a mix of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The main objective is to establish board presence early on using cards like Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and then maintain control through disruption with cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Stubborn Denial. By efficiently using mana fixing lands and a diverse array of creatures, spells, and removal, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and secure a swift victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Solitude to gain additional value from enters-the-battlefield abilities, creating a synergy with cards like Witch Enchanter and Boggart Trawler. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also providing flexibility for fetching key lands.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones with removal spells like Fatal Push, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent while disrupting their game plan. A key strategy is to use Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to repeatedly generate value from enter-the-battlefield effects and protect key threats. The deck's mana base supports its color requirements for its various spells and creatures, ensuring consistent and powerful plays throughout the game.

The main concept of this Naya Zoo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Malevolent Rumble to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Thraben Charm and Ranger-Captain of Eos for additional utility and Seasoned Pyromancer for card advantage. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah buffs up the team. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana consistency.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and played at instant speed using Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling. The combo involves sacrificing Cauldron Familiar multiple times with the help of Viscera Seer to trigger various effects and generate value. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Brightglass Gearhulk and Grist, the Hunger Tide to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect your own creatures. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents with a versatile mix of creature abilities and combo potential.
